text: The 1993 Fresno State Bulldogs football team represented California State University, FresnoThe official name of Fresno State has been California State University, Fresno since 1972. However, it is still commonly known as Fresno State. during the 1993 NCAA Division I-A football season as a member of the Western Athletic Conference (WAC). The team was led by head coach Jim Sweeney, in his sixteenth year, and they played their home games at Bulldog Stadium in Fresno, California. They finished the 1993 season as co-champions of the WAC, with a regular season record of eight wins and three losses (8–3, 6–2 WAC). As co-champions of the WAC, Fresno State earned a postseason bowl game after the 1993 season. They faced No. 17 Colorado in the Aloha Bowl, losing 30–41. ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== The following were selected in the 1994 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Trent Dilfer || Quarterback || 1 || 6 || Tampa Bay Buccaneers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Tydus Winans || Wide receiver || 3 || 68 || Washington Redskins |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Malcolm Floyd || Wide receiver || 3 || 101 || Houston Oilers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | James Burton || Defensive back || 5 || 151 || Kansas City Chiefs |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Anthony Daigle || Running back || 6 || 185 || Kansas City Chiefs |} The following finished their college career in 1993, were not drafted, but played in the NFL. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || First NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Ron Rivers || Running back || 1995 Detroit Lions |} ==Notes== ==References== Fresno State Bulldogs Category:Fresno State Bulldogs football seasons Category:Western Athletic Conference football champion seasons Fresno State Bulldogs f
